This subflow was created by the Web Services Wizard to invoke the update operation on https\://sungardasuat.service-now.com/change_request.do?wsdl. Note that the inputs to this flow which correspond to web service inputs are optional inputs.  This is due to the fact that web services definitions usually incorrectly indicate that too many inputs are required, and mirroring those settings in the flow would force you to enter unused values when running the flow.  The xmlTemplate input on the Invoke Method 2 step of this flow contains a template of the xml message to be sent, and the fields preceded by the comment "<\!--Optional\:-->" or "<\!--zero or more repetitions-->" are those which the web service indicates are optional; all others are indicated to be required.

a96b3e9c-4f86-4d99-878e-198728028aef.2f8aef9c-5a89-45b3-a01e-e77deb1e4881.description=
Checks to see if a string matches another string using a specific rule. Input toMatch is the actual string to check to see if it matches the matchTo expression.

Inputs\:
    matchType - The type of match to perform.
Valid values\: Exact Match, Contains, Contains Once, Does Not Contain, Match All Words, Match No Words, Regex
Default value\: Exact Match
    toMatch - The string to check if matches another string.
    matchTo - The string to match against. 
Examples\: If the matchType is RegEx, the input matchTo is the regular expression like \: ^-?\d+(([\.,]\d+)?)+$. 
    ignoreCase - Boolean value for whether or not to ignore case during match.
Valid values\: False, True
Default value\: False

Responses\:
    success - The String matched.
    failure - The string did not match, or something went wrong.
a96b3e9c-4f86-4d99-878e-198728028aef.34108ef9-c5ac-454b-94b4-19e05ac27b3e.callout=Should Backouts "Run Now" and if not, how/when do they actually run? May need to figure out how backouts will work before this can be answered. a96b3e9c-4f86-4d99-878e-198728028aef.52f6fbf7-e940-4377-9fa1-fe2388ba2a76.description=
Compares two strings, returning a true response if and only if they contain the same sequence of characters. A null string is considered to be equal to an empty string.

Inputs\:
    string1 - The first string. 
Default value\: "" (empty)
    string2 - The second string.
Default value\: "" (empty)
    ignoreCase - If set to 'true', then the comparison ignores case considerations. The two strings are considered equal ignoring case if they are of the same length and corresponding characters in the two strings are equal ignoring case. If set to any value other than 'true', then the strings must match exactly to be considered equal.

Responses\:
    true - If the two strings are equal.
    false - If the two strings are not equal.

a96b3e9c-4f86-4d99-878e-198728028aef.62e11b75-bee6-451f-8304-1be198b772bc.description=
If the input dateFormat is not specified, it converts a date in the format of date/time of OO Central Server's, which is dependant on the Java locale, to a date either in the format of date/time of OO Central Server's or in the format specified in the input outFormat. 

If the input dateFormat is specified, it converts a date in the format in dateFormat to a date either in the format of date/time of OO Central Server's or in the format specified in the input outFormat.

You can use flow "Get Current Date and Time" to check upon the default date/time format.  

For exmaple, if OO Central Server's locale is English, the input dateFormat is empty and the input outFormat is empty, the input date should be in the format of "July 13, 2006 10\:04\:08 AM". If the user specifies dateFormat as "dd-MM-YYYY HH\:mm\:ss", the input date should be in the format of "13-07-2006 10\:04\:08". If the input outFormat is empty, the result will be "July 13, 2006 10\:04\:08 AM". If the input outFormat is "yyyy-MM-dd", the result will be "2006-07-13". The dateFormat for "July 13, 2006 10\:04\:078 AM" is "MMM dd, yyyy HH\:mm\:ss a". 


Specify the date format with the following patterns\:

Letter 	Date or Time Component 	Presentation 	Examples
G 	Era designator 	Text 	                     AD
y 	Year 	                     Year 	                     1996; 96
M 	Month in year 	Month 	                     July; Jul; 07
w 	Week in year 	Number 	                     27
W 	Week in month 	Number 	                     2
D 	Day in year 	                     Number 	                     189
d 	Day in month 	Number 	                     10
F 	Day of week in month 	Number 	                     2
E 	Day in week   	Text 	                     Tuesday; Tue
a 	Am/pm marker 	Text 	                     PM
H 	Hour in day (0-23) 	Number 	                     0
k 	Hour in day (1-24) 	Number 	                     24
K 	Hour in am/pm (0-11) 	Number 	                     0
h 	Hour in am/pm (1-12) 	Number 	                     12
m 	Minute in hour 	Number 	                     30
s 	Second in minute 	Number 	                     55
S 	Millisecond 	                     Number 	                     978
z 	Time zone 	                     General time zone 	Pacific Standard Time; PST; GMT-08\:00
Z 	Time zone 	                     RFC 822 time zone 	-0800

So, for example\: the date "2006-07-10 15\:16\:14.766 PDT" would have the dateFormat "yyyy-MM-dd HH\:mm\:ss.SSS z".

You can also use single quotes (') to avoid text interpretation. The quoted text will simply be copied into the output string during formatting (if present in the outFormat) or matched against the input string during parsing (if present in the dateFormat). For example, the date value "2006-07-10T15\:16\:14.766Z" would have the dateFormat "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH\:mm\:ss.SSS'Z'". 


Inputs\:
date - The date to parse. If the input dateFormat is empty, the date must be in the format of date/time of OO Central Server's, which is dependant on the Java locale. If the input dateFormat is not empty, the date must be in the format specified in the input dateFormat.
dateFormat - The format of the input date. 
dateLocaleLang - The locale language for input dateFormat string. For example,  en or ja.  It will be ignored if dateFormat is empty. 
dateLocaleCountry - The locale country for input dateFormat string. For example, US or JP.  It will be ignored if dateFormat is empty or dateLocaleLang is empty. 
outFormat - The format of the output date/time. If it is empty, the output date/time will be in the format of date/time of OO Cental Server's, which is dependant on the Java locale.
outLocaleLang - The locale language for output string. For example,  en or ja. It will be ignored if outFormat is empty. 
outLocaleCountry - The locale country for output string. For example, US or JP. It will be ignored if outFormat is empty or outLocaleLang is empty.

Responses\:
success - The date was converted.
failure - The date could not be converted.

Result\:
The date in the new format.
The date in the new format.

a96b3e9c-4f86-4d99-878e-198728028aef.description=
Opens or updates a Change Ticket in Service Now and/or runs or schedules a run of an NA script.  Will also open a Request Ticket if the device is a firewall.

This flow is used for one of five operations related to NA Change Requests.  The inputs will be marked with what is required for each operation.

The five operations are (in order of precedence)\:

CANCEL- Cancel a scheduled change.
CONFIRM - Confirm a change as "Successful" or "Unsuccessful".
BACKOUT - Backout a change that's already run (within 24 hours).
RUNNOW - Run a script at the next earliest possible time.
SCHEDULE - Schedule the script to run at a specified time (default if no other operation is triggered)

Inputs\:
phost - Required for RUNNOW and SCHEDULE - Name of the device where the script will run
phostType -  Required for RUNNOW and SCHEDULE - Type of device for phost (valid options are Firewall, Switch, or Router)
scriptName -  Required for RUNNOW and SCHEDULE - Name of the NA script
scriptVariables -  Required for RUNNOW and SCHEDULE - Variables for the NA script
startDateTime -  Required for ALL RUNS - The date and time to run the script (should be the current date/time for RUNNOW)
company -  Required for RUNNOW and SCHEDULE - Company of submitting user from ViewPoint
requested_by -  Required for RUNNOW and SCHEDULE - Email of submitting user from ViewPoint
sys_id - Required for CANCEL, CONFIRM, and BACKOUT - The ticket's sys_id
cancelScheduledChange -  Set to 'True' to perform a CANCEL operation -  Cancels a change that has already been scheduled.
confirmChange - Set to 'True' to perform a CONFIRM operation - Confirms a change that has already run as either successful or unsuccessful.
confirmationStatus - Required for CONFIRM - The status to the change to (valid options are Successful or Unsuccessful).
backoutChange -  Set to 'True' to perform a BACKOUT operation - Backs a change out according to the Backout Plan.  Also closes the ticket, opens a new 'backout' ticket, and cancels the scheduled ticket close flow.
runNow -  Set to 'True' to perform a RUNNOW operation - Runs a script at the earliest possible time and creates a ticket for the change.

Outputs\:
sys_id - The Service Now system identifier for the change.
ticketNum - The Change Ticket number in Service Now (eg CHG\#\#\#\#)
docRequestNum - The Request Ticket number for the Document Request (eg RITM\#\#\#\#)

Responses\:
Success - The requested operation completed successfully
Failure - There was an error attempting to complete the operation
a96b3e9c-4f86-4d99-878e-198728028aef.fd32ed90-24f0-44d6-abef-83344c24468b.description=
Checks to see if a string matches another string using a specific rule. Input toMatch is the actual string to check to see if it matches the matchTo expression.

Inputs\:
    matchType - The type of match to perform.
Valid values\: Exact Match, Contains, Contains Once, Does Not Contain, Match All Words, Match No Words, Regex
Default value\: Exact Match
    toMatch - The string to check if matches another string.
    matchTo - The string to match against. 
Examples\: If the matchType is RegEx, the input matchTo is the regular expression like \: ^-?\d+(([\.,]\d+)?)+$. 
    ignoreCase - Boolean value for whether or not to ignore case during match.
Valid values\: False, True
Default value\: False

Responses\:
    success - The String matched.
    failure - The string did not match, or something went wrong.
flow.name: Run ViewPoint Change Request
